name: Offshore Shell Company
description: Use of a non-operational entity in a low-tax or high-secrecy jurisdiction to hold assets or launder funds.
indicators: Payments to entities in known tax havens (Cayman Islands, BVI, Panama, Seychelles, Switzerland)
Vendor address matches a 'Registered Agent' or 'Mass Registration' address (e.g., PO Box 123, Ugland House)
Invoices for vague services like 'Consulting', 'Management Fees', or 'Software Licensing' with round numbers
Entity has no web presence, LinkedIn employees, or physical footprint
Sudden large transfers to a previously unknown entity just before litigation
detection_methods: Cross-reference addresses with 'Offshore Leaks' database or known registered agent addresses
Analyze swift codes for correspondent banking trails
counter_measures: File 28 U.S.C. ยง 1782 discovery request for foreign evidence
Subpoena US correspondent banks for wire details

name: Undisclosed Domestic/Foreign Trust
description: Transferring ownership of assets to a trust to remove them from the individual's legal name while retaining control.
indicators: Regular payments labeled 'Trust Distribution' or 'Trustee Fees'
Property deeds showing transfer to a Trust entity for $1 or 'Love and Affection'
Checks written to 'The [Name] Family Trust'
Sudden removal of assets from personal financial statements
Continued use of an asset (e.g., vacation home) after alleged transfer
detection_methods: Search county land records for Grantor/Grantee index matches
Review tax returns (Schedule B, Form 3520) for foreign trust reporting
Analyze bank statements for recurring payments to trust entities
counter_measures: Motion to compel production of Trust Instrument
Depose the Trustee regarding 'Sham Trust' or 'Alter Ego' theory
Petition to pierce the trust veil if self-settled

name: Nominee / Straw Man Ownership
description: Placing assets in the name of a friend, relative, or employee to hide true beneficial ownership.
indicators: Asset held by a person with insufficient income to afford it (e.g., student, elderly relative)
Subject continues to pay maintenance, insurance, or taxes for the asset
Subject holds 'Power of Attorney' over the nominee's accounts
Nominee has no involvement in the management of the business asset
detection_methods: Lifestyle analysis of the nominee vs. asset value
Search for 'Side Letters' or 'Deed of Trust' documents
Trace source of funds for the initial purchase
counter_measures: Depose the nominee regarding source of funds
Forensic tracing of the purchase money trail

name: Lifestyle vs. Reported Income Discrepancy
description: Spending significantly more than reported income, suggesting unreported cash or hidden accounts.
indicators: Credit card bills exceeding total reported net income
Cash purchases of luxury items (cars, jewelry, art) not reflected in bank withdrawals
Mortgage payments or rent far exceeding 30-40% of reported income
No withdrawals for daily living expenses (groceries, gas) - implies cash hoard
detection_methods: Perform 'Source and Application of Funds' analysis
Calculate 'Net Worth Method' (Assets - Liabilities = Net Worth; Change in NW + Living Expenses = Income)
Review credit card statements for luxury travel/goods
counter_measures: Subpoena credit card issuers for full transaction history

name: Cryptocurrency Layering
description: Using crypto to move funds out of the banking system and into anonymous wallets.
indicators: Transfers to known crypto exchanges (Coinbase, Binance, Kraken)
Large round-dollar transfers to 'Unknown' entities
Purchase of 'Mining Equipment' or 'Server Hosting'
Keywords: 'Wallet', 'Seed', 'Key', 'Ledger', 'Trezor', 'Metamask'
detection_methods: Trace funds to exchange deposit addresses
Search email/cloud for wallet backup phrases or exchange confirmations
counter_measures: Subpoena the exchange for KYC and transaction history
Forensic imaging of devices to find wallet keys
